website_summaries.verdict: If you have an older dog with weight and joint issues, ask your veterinarian about this prescription diet that has delivered proven results for many senior canines.
pros: Designed by veterinarians to address weight gain and joint pain — two issues that are common in older dogs
Made with omega fatty acids that benefit joints as well as skin and coat
Blend of protein from quality meat sources and fiber derived from fruit and vegetables promote healthy weight
cons: Expensive, and requires a prescription from a veterinarian to purchase
Kibble may be too large for some small breeds
Not all dogs will like it

customer_reviews.title: Their vet contact is useless. Good luck.
customer_reviews.text: My pet’s prescription is at Banfield Pet Hospital and is current. Checked with Banfield to insure this. I’m holding the prescription in my hand. I could upload a PDF of it with the order. BUT EVERY TIME I ORDER: “Ordered Cancelled. Can not contact vet.” after 5 days of waiting. Each time. Useless. Upset. Dog needs this.
customer_reviews.author: Fort Lauderdale

customer_reviews.title: My dog's knees are better
customer_reviews.text: Vet prescribed this to my overweight dog with bad knees. He hasn't lost weight (our fault with snacks and table scraps), but the vet says his knees look better and he never limps anymore.
customer_reviews.author: iobtx

customer_reviews.title: Not Chicken Allergy Friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing against the shipper. Sent in a timely fashion arrived in perfect condition. The problem is that my poor dog needs this food because of a CCL rupture on her left knee and it was recommended by her orthopedic surgeon. However, Science Diet uses chicken in almost all of their food and my dog just so happens to be allergic to chicken. Now my poor pup has an uncomfortable limp, limp is not food related we are waiting for her surgery appointment, as well as hives on her belly and back. Poor babe is miserable. She's losing weight but she just seems so done with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Nyx

customer_reviews.title: Really expensive but it works
customer_reviews.text: I had my dog on Costco Diet food but he wasn't losing any weight. Vet prescribed this and he's finally losing weight.
customer_reviews.author: iobtx

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The spaniel is always hungry and looking for food. This is a great product recommended by our vet. It is filling yet not so many calories, etc.. Winston has lost 2 lbs and we can increase for maintenance if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth J Soliday

customer_reviews.title: Yorkie rejection
customer_reviews.text: My Yorker didn’t like this the bites were too big & chunky & I gave the food to my brother they have a golden Retriever, I’m going to order & try the small bites this Wednesday is payday!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria De Los Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great for weight loss!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect treats for my pet. I break them in half and give 2 halves per day. Has really helped with weight loss in combination with the metabolic + mobility food. I recommend these treats to anyone looking for a weight loss solution for their pet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: effective metabolic and joint food
customer_reviews.text: Food is great, dog eats it and moving well. It's nice to have all the nutritional steps in one feed. However, we had a pooper before this food and now it's crazy. It could be close to 5 big poops a day which is why I think the dog's losing weight. If your dog was a pooper before, just be forewarned:)
customer_reviews.author: brady12

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food
customer_reviews.text: My dog has irritable bowel syndrome so my vet recommends this dog food. It is clean and a little expensive, but I will continually use it because it helps my dog
customer_reviews.author: jeanette long

customer_reviews.title: This food did help my dog loose weight. However ...
customer_reviews.text: This food did help my dog loose weight. However, I am concerned about the price here. Our Vet charges $80 for this size bag and often has a $10 coupon. Call your vet before you order.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: She loves it and doesn't seem "hungry" like with other high end diets we've tried
customer_reviews.text: Recently had to put my female boxer on this diet. She loves it and doesn't seem "hungry" like with other high end diets we've tried. However, this bag is $85 at my vet's office. I love Amazon but this is one purchase I will not be making from you.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Walker

customer_reviews.title: Holy moly this stuff is great. Giving my dog a diet was the worst ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly this stuff is great. Giving my dog a diet was the worst and she hated every minute of it, but once we switched to this food she almost entirely stopped begging since she was full. Expensive tho, as everyone else has commented, check with your vet for a cheaper option
customer_reviews.author: nick

product_meta.title: Hill'S Prescription Diet Metabolic + Mobility Canine - Chicken Flavor - 24Lbs
product_meta.description: Weight + Joint CareJust like the human epidemic, almost 50% of the pet population is overweight. Even a little extra weight can impact the pets quality of life and relationship with family because that extra weight can reduce play time, impact mobility and affect the lifelong general health of your dog. Hill's nutritionists & veterinarians developed Prescription Diet Metabolic + Mobility Canine clinical nutrition especially formulated to help manage your dog's weight and joint health. In fact, Metabolic + Mobility Canine has clinically proven nutrition to improve mobility in as little as 21 days AND reduce body weight by 13% in 60 days.
feature_bullets: Vitamins E & C, Lipoic Acid, and Beta Carotene help defend cells against free radical oxidation and counteract inflammation
